classSpec.desc: Attributes that express the relationship between a component and its host.

sch:rule.sch:assert: The comptype attribute may occur on only when it is a descendant of a componentList.

valItem.desc: A physical and logical part of entity.
A physical, but not logical component of the entity, usually included as part of the binding process.
A logical component of the entity physically held elsewhere.

classSpec.desc: Groups elements that may appear inline when the msdesc module is active.

elementSpec.desc: Holds a description of any additional material bound with an item, such as non-contemporaneous documents or fragments.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: (addition description) – Provides a description of significant additions found within an item, such as marginalia or other annotations.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: (binding) – Contains a description of one binding, i.e., type of covering, boards, etc. applied to an item.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: (binding description) – Describes the present and former bindings of an item.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: Describes the system used to ensure correct ordering of the quires making up an item, typically by means of annotations at the foot of the page.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: Records a description of how the leaves or bifolia of an item are physically arranged.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: Contains a statement providing information regarding the date, place, agency, or reason for production of the item.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: (decoration description) – Contains a description of the decoration of an item.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: (decoration note) – Contains a description of one or more decorative features of an item.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: Contains the explicit of a manuscript item; that is, the closing words of the text proper, exclusive of any rubric or colophon which might follow it.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: Describes the numbering system or systems used to count the leaves or pages in a codex.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: Contains a heraldic formula or phrase, typically found as part of a blazon, coat of arms, etc.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: Describes how text is laid out on the page, including information about any ruling, pricking, or other evidence of page-preparation techniques.

attDef.desc: Specifies the number of columns per page.

remarks.p: A single number indicates that all pages have this number of columns. Two numbers mean that the number of columns per page varies between the values supplied.

attDef.desc: Specifies the number of ruled text lines per column.

remarks.p: A single number indicates that all columns have this number of ruled lines. Two numbers mean that the number of text lines per column varies between the values supplied.

attDef.desc: Specifies the number of written text lines per column.

remarks.p: A single number indicates that all columns have this number of written text lines. Two numbers mean that the number of text lines per column varies between the values supplied.

attDef.desc: Specifies the number of ruled staves per column.

remarks.p: A single number indicates that all columns have this number of ruled staves. Two numbers mean that the number of ruled staves per column varies between the values supplied.

attDef.desc: Specifies the number of written staves per column.

remarks.p: A single number indicates that all columns have this number of written staves. Two numbers mean that the number of written staves per column varies between the values supplied.
This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: (layout description) – Collects layout descriptions.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: Defines a location within a manuscript or manuscript component, usually as a (possibly discontinuous) sequence of folio references.

attDef.desc: Identifies the foliation scheme in terms of which the location is being specified by pointing to some foliation element defining it, or to some other equivalent resource.
Specifies the starting point of the location in a normalized form.
Specifies the end-point of the location in a normalized form.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: (locus group) – Groups locations which together form a distinct but discontinuous item within a manuscript or manuscript part, according to a specific foliation.

attDef.desc: Identifies the foliation scheme in terms of which the location is being specified by pointing to some foliation element defining it, or to some other equivalent resource.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: Contains a string of words through which a manuscript signals the beginning or end of a text division, often with an assertion as to its author and title, which is in some way set off from the text itself, usually in red ink, or by use of different size or type of script, or some other such visual device.

valItem.desc: Signals beginning of a text division.
Makrs the end of a text division.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: (script description) – Contains a description of the letters or characters used in an autographic item.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: (script note) – Describes a particular script distinguished within the description of an autographic item.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: A single seal or similar attachment.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: (seal description) – Describes the seals or similar external attachments applied to an item.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: (second folio) – Marks the word or words taken from a fixed point in a codex (typically the beginning of the second leaf) in order to provide a unique identifier for the item.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: Provides a description of the leaf or quire signatures found within a codex.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: Contains a word or phrase describing an official mark indicating ownership, genuineness, validity, etc.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: Provides a description of the physical support material of a written item.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: (support description) – Groups elements describing the physical support material of an item.

attDef.desc: Short, project-defined name for the material composing the majority of the support.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: (type description) – Contains a description of the typefaces or other aspects of the printing of a printed source.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

elementSpec.desc: (type note) – Describes a particular font or other significant typographic feature of a printed resource.

remarks.p: This element is modeled on an element in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) standard.

sch:rule.context: mei:catchwords | mei:fingerprint | mei:heraldry | mei:secFolio | mei:signatures | mei:watermark
sch:rule.sch:assert: The element may only appear as a descendant of the physDesc element.

sch:assert.test: ancestor::mei:physDesc or parent::mei:contentItem or ancestor::mei:source[ancestor::mei:componentList[ancestor::mei:sourceDesc or ancestor::mei:sourceList or ancestor::mei:workList]]

sch:rule.sch:assert: The element may only appear as a descendant of a physDesc element, a contentItem element, or a source element that is a component of another source or work.
